page.title: 10Saighton Village life (1).
page.content: All property in Saighton is owned by the 6th Duke of Westminster, and Lady Mary Grosvenor,the daughter of the 2nd Duke,lives there.The majority of the 256 people(13 being over 65 & 1 over 90) are pensioners of the Grosvenor Estate & the rest work on it.Some of the Victorian Gothic houses have sugar loaf chimneys & all have gardens.They now have inside sanitation,some have garages & some telephones (but near the primary school is a public phone). There is mains sewerage & electricity but no gas.Once "The White Horse"pub the shop-cum-post office is the centre of village gossip (mainly by women).By the shop is a post box with twice daily collections.There is no church (& Bruera church is 1 mile away) so Holy Communion service is held once a month at Saighton Grange school even though there is a village hall.
